title: MongoDB Aggregation Basics
subject: MongoDB
theory: Aggregation operations process data records and return computed results. For simple tasks, MongoDB provides helper methods like countDocuments() and distinct(). For complex tasks, the Aggregation Pipeline is used.

interview_questions.question: Difference between count() and countDocuments()?
interview_questions.answer: count() uses metadata (can be inaccurate with sharding/cleanups). countDocuments() runs an aggregation scan (accurate).

exam_notes: distinct() returns array of unique values.
summary: Aggregation allows you to derive insights and metrics from your raw data.
